qualifiers.toolTip: Input Friedel pairs I+/I- or F+/F- for SAD, SIRAS or MAD phasing
Input Friedel pairs I+/I- or F+/F- for MAD phasing

Input Friedel pairs I+/I- or F+/F- for MAD phasing
Select this option if you wish to input HKL or SCA file(s) (both unmerged and merged data will be accepted)
Input unmerged or merged hkl/sca with anomalous signal for SAD, SIRAS or MAD phasing
Input unmerged or merged hkl/sca with anomalous signal for MAD phasing
Input unmerged or merged hkl/sca with anomalous signal for MAD phasing
Input unmerged or merged hkl/sca with anomalous signal for MAD phasing
Substructure (heavy atom) element type (periodic table symbol)
Input intensities or structure factors for the "native" crystal
Input intensities or structure factors in sca/hkl for the "native" crystal
Wavelength at which the dataset was measured. Used for estimation of f',f'' if they were not specified by user, otherwise ignored
Wavelength at which the dataset was measured. Used for estimation of f',f'' if they were not specified by user, otherwise ignored
Wavelength at which the dataset was measured. Used for estimation of f',f'' if they were not specified by user, otherwise ignored
Wavelength at which the dataset was measured. Used for estimation of f',f'' if they were not specified by user, otherwise ignored
Anomalous scattering coefficient f' for the dataset #1 and substructure atom type. A good estimate can be obtained from a fluorescence scan.
Anomalous scattering coefficient f'' for the dataset #1 and substructure atom type. A good estimate can be obtained from a fluorescence scan.
Anomalous scattering coefficient f' for the dataset #2 and substructure atom type. A good estimate can be obtained from a fluorescence scan.
Anomalous scattering coefficient f'' for the dataset #2 and substructure atom type. A good estimate can be obtained from a fluorescence scan.
Anomalous scattering coefficient f' for the dataset #3 and substructure atom type. A good estimate can be obtained from a fluorescence scan.
Anomalous scattering coefficient f'' for the dataset #3 and substructure atom type. A good estimate can be obtained from a fluorescence scan.
Anomalous scattering coefficient f' for the dataset #4 and substructure atom type. A good estimate can be obtained from a fluorescence scan.
Anomalous scattering coefficient f'' for the dataset #4 and substructure atom type. A good estimate can be obtained from a fluorescence scan.
Cell dimension "a" (in A)
Cell dimension "b" (in A)
Cell dimension "c" (in A)
Cell angle alpha (in deg)
Cell angle beta (in deg)
Cell angle gamma (in deg)
Spacegroup (CCP4 style; for example P212121)
Expected total number of substructure atoms in the asymmetric unit
Number of disulphides in the asymmetric unit that substructure detection should search for as single atoms and then model as disulfides
Protein sequence (will be used for parameter estimation and model building)
Input (partial) model
Input substructure model (for phasing purposes)
Input phase distribution
Select this option if you have initial phases for input
Select this option if you wish to replace methionines by selenomethionines in the input partial model
The pipeline will start with this process (the actual pipeline and parameters can be found in Advanced Options)

qualifiers.toolTip: The pipeline will end with this process (the actual pipeline and parameters an be found in Advanced Options)
qualifiers.menuText: Substructure detection,Den.mod. + poly-Ala tracing,Substructure phasing,Substructure improvement,Hand determination,Density modification,Model building,Refinement

qualifiers.toolTip: Select this option if you wish to use SHELXC->SHELXD->SHELXE in the pipeline (the actual pipeline and parameters can be found in Advanced Options)
Select this option if the substructure from the crystal #1 is also present in the "native" crystal
Select this option if data from a "native" crystal is available (will be used for model building and refinement as well as phasing)
Select this option if you have another anomalously scattering dataset collected at a different wavelength (will be used for MAD phasing)
Select this option if you have another anomalously scattering dataset collected at a different wavelength (will be used for MAD phasing)
Select this option if you have another anomalously scattering dataset collected at a different wavelength (will be used for MAD phasing)
Specify whether the dataset #1 was collected at peak, inflection point, high or low remote of the anomalous scattering curve (may be often omitted for SAD,SIRAS)
Specify whether the dataset #2 was collected at peak, inflection point, high or low remote of the anomalous scattering curve
Specify whether the dataset #3 was collected at peak, inflection point, high or low remote of the anomalous scattering curve
Specify whether the dataset #4 was collected at peak, inflection point, high or low remote of the anomalous scattering curve
Select this option if you have a partial model (for example from molecular replacement) that needs to be rebuilt
Select this option if you wish to remove all protein atoms from the inputted partial model and start phasing only from the anomalous substucture atoms present in the model
Specify whether free set of reflections should be excluded in refinement to calculate Rfree. Either an existing free set of reflections can be inputted or a new free set can be generated.
Number of monomers in the asymmetric unit (expected)
Solvent content in the crystal (expected)
Number of residues per monomer
Input the (expected) number of residues per monomer.
Select this option if sequence for the protein is available (recommended)
Specify the existing 'free' set of reflections to be used
Specify the ratio of reflections tagged as 'free' and used for validation purposes
The program that will be used in the process of substructure improvement
Atoms above the specified RMS threshold in the anomalous difference map will be added to the substructure
Removes substr. atoms with occupancies refined below the specified value.
Number of iterations of new substructure atoms picking
Number of refinement cycles in each picking iteration
Additional keywords for substructure improvement
Program used for FA estimation
Program used for substructure determination
High resolution cutoff used in substructure determination. A starting point rule of thumb for SAD data is resolution + 0.5A.
Determine the high resolution cutoff for substructure determination from CCanom1/2 (only available if unmerged data inputted to SHELXC)

Substructure determination high resolution cutoff radius: cutoffs will be tested in this radius around the specified initial cutoff. A radius of 0.5A around data resolution+0.5A is typically sufficient.

In the specified substructure determination high resolution cutoff radius, the testing cutoff values will be derived by increasing/decreasing by the step value. A step of 0.25A is typically sufficient.

If this threshold is reached, substructure determination will stop early, assuming a solution that will be used for phasing (saving some time for the "easy" datasets). CFOM is defined as CC+CCweak for SHELXD, CC*FOM*CLD for PRASA

If CFOM from SHELXD is smaller than this threshold, thorough building will be used: more cycles, search for helices, increased search time factor. Set to 0 to disable, set to 1000 to always use thorough building.
Number of substructure detection trials performed if CFOM threshold is not reached.

Number of CPU threads used to improve the speed of substructure detection via parallelization. All the local CPU's used by default. Only recommended to set manually in case of limited responsivness of the default setting.
The (expected) minimal distance between substructure atoms
Select this option if you expect that (some) substucture atoms can be in special positions in the cell
The solutions found can be optimized and a different solution can be picked (by default, multiple solutions are optimized only in case of a small FOM)
The found substructure will be cut to max. the specified number of substructure atoms in the asymmetric unit, by removal of the atoms from the smallest peaks
Substructures with number of significant peaks (in ASU) below the specified number will be ignored.
Specify any additional program keywords (separate multiple keywords by a comma). Keywords specified here will always take preference over defaults or other settings.
Program used for substructure phasing and refinement
Number of substructure refinement cycles
Specify any additional program keywords
If selected, hand determination will be performed. If not selected, the input hand will be assumed correct.
Number of density modification cycles in hand determination
The requested difference between hands for hand discrimination. Set to 20 or more to always use both hands in model building. Set to 0 to always take hand with the better score.
Program used for density modification in hand determination
Program used for phase combination in hand determination
Number of density modification cycles
If this threshold is reached, density modification will stop early, assuming a good map that can be used for building (saving some time for the "easy" datasets)
Program used for density modification
Program used for phase combination in density modification
Specify any custom phase combination program options (separate multiple options by a comma)
Specify any custom density modification program options (separate multiple options by a comma)
Number of density modification cycles per each model building iteration
Number of model building cycles
If this threshold is reached, poly-Ala tracing will stop early, assuming a good quality model has been obtained (saving time for the "easy" datasets)
If this correlation coefficient threshold is reached, hand is considered determined and poly-Ala tracing for the other hand will stop
Use "thorough" SHELXE building (more cycles, search for helices, increased search time factor)

Specify any additional SHELXE arguments, separate multiple arguments by a comma (example: -z for substructure optimization). Arguments specified here will always take preference over defaults or other settings.
Use the "combined" Crank2 building algorithm - a multivariate SAD function combining information from anomalous and non-anomalous signal from data, density modification and model building
Minimal number of model building iterations
Maximal number of model building iterations
Select this option to estimate NCS (can be time consuming with large number of atoms)
Select this option to estimate NCS from the partial model
Skip the first model building iteration (the initial phase and DM restrained refinement cycles are performed with the model inputted to this step)
Select this option if the actual model should be inputted to each building cycle (if not selected then alternate building from phases only and from phases+model)
Option to start building using ShelxE backbone tracing and later switch to Buccaneer. May improve the building at higher resolutions.

Parallel model building: the specified number of models is built and refined simultanously, often improving the final model quality. Parallel building is performed if a value larger than 1 is specified; 5 may a good value. Expect significant slowdown if the specified number is larger than the number of free cores of your system.
Program used for real space density modification within the "combined" model building
Specify any custom density modification program options (separate multiple options by a comma)
Specify any custom SHELXE program options (separate multiple options by a comma)
Program used for data and density modification phase restrained refinement
Program used for automatic real space model building
Specify any custom model building program options (separate multiple options by a comma)
Program used for model refinement between the model building iterations
Number of model building iterations
Program used for refinement
Number of refinement cycles
Select this option to exclude the "free" reflections in refinement
Select this option to exclude the "free" reflections in model building and refinement
Specify when the "free" reflections will be excluded in the "combined" model building

qualifiers.toolTip: Remove all the intermediate MTZ files as the job ends
